meanings.definition: A tax or tribute paid to the Danes in the Middle Ages.
meanings.sent1: The villagers reluctantly handed over the danegelts to the invading Danes.
meanings.sent2: The king collected danegelts from the townspeople to appease the raiders.
meanings.sent3: The Danes were quite pleased with the danegelts they received, thinking it was a generous gift.
meanings.sent4: The danegelts flowed like a river into the hands of the conquerors.
meanings.sent5: The danegelts were like golden keys unlocking the safety of the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Money paid as a ransom or bribe to avoid harm or punishment.
meanings.sent1: The merchant offered danegelts to the bandits to secure his release.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy nobleman paid danegelts to keep his family safe from harm.
meanings.sent3: The thief demanded danegelts from the shopkeeper to spare his goods.
meanings.sent4: The danegelts acted as a shield against the looming threat of danger.
meanings.sent5: The sound of danegelts clinking brought relief to those in peril.
